name: Vietnamese Pork Spare Rib Soup with Potatoes, Carrots and Cauliflower (Canh Sườn Khoai Tây Ca Rốt Bông Cải Trắng)
description: Simple, delicious, and comforting Vietnamese soup made with easy-to-find and affordable ingredients. It's the perfect soup for cold winter days and for those who feel under the weather. This hearty and filling soup can be eaten on its own or enjoyed as a side dish with steamed rice.
keywords: pork rib soup recipe, pork rib soup, vietnamese pork rib soup, vietnamese pork rib soup recipe, vietnamese canh recipe, vietnamese home cooking recipe, vietnamese canh recipe with pork ribs, vietnamese canh recipe with pork spare ribs, pork rib soup with potatoes carrots and cauliflower, vietnamese soup recipe with cauliflower, vietnamese soup recipe with potatoes, vietnamese soup recipe with carrots, vietnamese pork potato carrot soup, vietnamese pork potato carrot cauliflower soup, viet food, viet recipe, vietnamese pork bone soup, pork bone soup recipe, pork bone soup, pork rib soup with potatoes and carrots, vietnamese pork pork bone soup recipe, pork rib soup vietnamese, vietnamese recipes, vietnamese home cooking, Canh Sườn Khoai Tây Ca Rốt Bông Cải Trắng, canh suon khoay tay ca rot, canh suon, Canh Sườn Khoai Tây Ca Rốt, Canh Sườn, Canh Sườn Bông Cải Trắng, canh suon bong cai trang

video.name: Vietnamese Pork Spare Rib Soup with Potatoes, Carrots and Cauliflower (Canh Suon Khoai Tay)
video.description: Vietnamese Pork Spare Rib Soup with Potatoes, Carrots and Cauliflower

recipeIngredient: 1 lb pork spare ribs (cut into 1½” pieces)
½ teaspoon chicken or mushroom bouillon powder
recipeInstructions: In a medium-sized pot, add vegetable oil and heat on high. Add whites of green onions, shallots, and garlic. Fry until fragrant (about 20 seconds).
Add pork ribs and toss in the aromatics until covered. Add water. Bring the pot to a low simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Skim off the impurities at the top, if needed.
Add the carrots, potatoes, and cauliflower. Cook until vegetables are chopstick-tender (about 10-12 minutes).
Season to taste with fish sauce, salt, chicken bouillon powder, and ground black pepper. When ready to serve, garnish with remaining green onions and an additional sprinkle of ground black pepper.
